oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Report of transportation issued by the Quartermaster's Deptartment

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Transportation, Military; Railroads; War and transportation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report of Transportation Issued by the Quartermaster's Dept. from June 17 - July 11, 1866. Handwritten document listing destinations and mileage: Marietta (116 miles), Knoxville (112 miles), Tunnel Hill, Georgia (29 miles), Nashville (151 miles), Atlanta (136 miles), et cetera.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: William Alonzo Wainwright, United States Assistant Quartermaster Records, 1861-1870
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Travel was strictly monitored and curtailed during the war and into the post-war period. Both military personnel and civilians were required to apply to the Quartermaster's Department for authorization and travel by train.
